newsitem.title: HONDURAS: Job benefits sought for prostitutes in Honduras.
newsitem.headline: Job benefits sought for prostitutes in Honduras.

text.p: A Honduran health-care workers' union on Friday urged brothel owners and the government to provide job benefits and social security for prostitutes.

"Sex workers should receive similar treatment as other workers," Henry Echeverria, a leader of the Hospital and Medical Workers Union, told reporters. "They don't have the right to vacation pay, social security, Christmas bonuses, benefits and overtime."
The petition was sent to the Labour and Health ministries, as well as private social organisations.
"Prostitutes are victims of exploitation by the owners of businesses that deal in human flesh," Echeverria said. "They should be obliged to provide social benefits."
